text:
Fall River is a city in Greenwood County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 162 people lived there.
History.
Fall River was laid out in 1879. It is named after the river it is on, the Fall River.
Geography.
Fall River is at (37.607361, -96.028769). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
Weather.
Fall River has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. The Köppen Climate Classification system says that Fall River has a humid subtropical climate, shortened to "Cfa" on climate maps.
2010 census.
In 2010, there were 162 people, 80 households, and 43 families living in Fall River. The population density was. 95.1% of the people were White, 1.2% were Native American, 0.6% were Asian, and 3.1% were from two or more races. 6.8% of the people were Hispanic or Latino of any race.
2000 census.
In 2000, there were 156 people, 74 households, and 44 families living in Fall River. The population density was 705.6 people per square mile (273.8/km²).
